course_title: Seminar in Fiction:English: Contemporary Women Novelists
class_notes:
Course Topic: Contemporary Women Novelists-This seminar class juxtaposes 3 of the greatest 20th-century women novelists, Lessing, Morrison, and Gordimer, with 3 emerging 21st-century women novelists who have received considerable critical and media attention: Rooney, Hall, and Newitz. We will analyze how this group of writers molds new stories about old themes such as politics and women's friendships, and how they remake genre fiction.
Requirements are class attendance and informed participation, regular response paragraphs, a short paper, and a long paper.
PLEASE NOTE: Enrollment is by permission only. Please email the instructor (martine.brownley@emory.edu), indicating your year of study, your major, and the reasons you are interested in the class, for information about permissions.
course_description: Studies in narrative fiction and narrative forms. Readings vary and may focus on one or more authors or on questions of literary art. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
